Born: 1860 (approximate)

Birth Place:

Death Place: Richmond, Virginia

Spouse: James Monroe Carter; Alfred or Alpheus W. Folkes? (mystery: Annie and Alfred/Alpheus are buried side by side, but according to all records we've found, Alfred/Alpheus was married to Bettie W. Knight, from 1889 until his death in 1922)

Parents: William Singleton, Margaret Lee or Tate

Children: Charles Boyd Carter, Harry F. D. Carter, James Harvey Carter

Other Family: Howard C. Singleton, James M. Singleton, Ada C. (Singleton) Williams, Mary Singleton, William G. Singleton, Meschach Singleton, Abednego Sumner Singleton, Margaret Phenola (Singleton) Valentine, Hannah Singleton (siblings)

Erin Hollaway Palmer

Florence Capela (Jackson) Judkins

Florence Capela Jackson married Julius Caesar Judkins on June 10, 1919, at Richmond’s Ebenezer Baptist Church. He lived in Marion, Indiana, where he practiced law, but had studied earlier at Virginia Union University — perhaps their paths crossed then? Mrs. Judkins returned to Marion with her new husband but died little more than a year later after giving birth to their son, Julius Caesar Judkins Jr. He followed in his father’s footsteps and became a lawyer before his untimely death at age 35.

Florence C. (Jackson) Judkins
